clinical_study.official_title: Reconsolidation as a Treatment Target for Cocaine Addiction

lead_sponsor.agency: McGill University Health Centre/Research Institute of the McGill University Health Centre

clinical_study.source: McGill University Health Centre/Research Institute of the McGill University Health Centre

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective is to investigate the potential ability of Inderal (propranolol hydrochloride) to diminish the reconsolidation of motivationally potent drug-related cues in cocaine dependent participants. If effective in this laboratory model, Inderal may have clinical efficacy.

primary_outcome.time_frame: One day and one month post-treatment
primary_outcome.description: One day and one month after the intervention, the investigators will measure drug craving using visual analog scales (VAS) and the Cocaine Craving Questionnaire (CCQ).

secondary_outcome.description: One month after the intervention, participants will be interviewed about their drug and alcohol use

intervention.description: Inderal vs. placebo will be administered with or without cocaine cues
